channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Federal Reserve’s interest-rate panic is creating a windfall for retirees
item.description: Those who need to generate low-risk income out of their savings can earn more than they could have done even a few weeks ago.

item.title: Gold Demand in China Likely to Improve on 'Rekindled' Sentiment
item.description: Retail demand for gold in China is likely to improve, CCB International said, after sales rebounded 26% on month in August.

item.title: As Conflict Spreads, Will Defense Stocks Regain Their Cold War Allure?
item.description: Despite the threat of multipolar competition and a rearmament in Europe, military budgets are far from their 1980s highs.

item.title: Norwegian Krone Looks Likely to Fall, Says Danske Bank
item.description: Danske Bank remains cautious on the Norwegian krone in the near term, preferring to sell the currency on any short-term rallies.

item.title: China Stock Rally Shifting Into Phase Two
item.description: The China stock market rally looks set to shift into phase two, featuring slower gains and higher volatility but a renewed focus on earnings and valua...

item.title: Groceries are more affordable now than in 2019. So why are people still so mad about prices?
item.description: For the average worker, grocery prices are about as affordable as they were pre-pandemic. But the costs are still a sore spot for consumers — and a fo...

item.title: Oil Edges Up Amid Middle East Risks, Hurricane Milton
item.description: Oil prices edged higher in early European trade on fears that Hurricane Milton could cause significant supply disruptions in the U.S. and concerns ove...

item.title: Utilities stocks were Wall Street’s hottest trade this year. Are they at risk of fizzling out?
item.description: Utilities have been on a dazzling run in 2024 — but some believe rockier times lie ahead.

item.title: Inflation still slowing, CPI to show, but some warning signs might flash
item.description: The rate of U.S. inflation is likely to slow again in September, but fresh doubts have emerged about whether the Federal Reserve can hit its 2% target...

item.title: The Dow is running hot. History says that’s usually a good sign.
item.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is showing “impressive and persistent momentum on daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly time frames,” says SentimenTrade...
